Submodules¶

straph.attributed.algorithms.pairwise module¶

straph.attributed.algorithms.pairwise.F_Algorithm(S, L_functions)[source]¶

An implementation of F-Algorithm (add ref). Pairwise Algorithm to compute temporal paths in Stream Graph.

Parameters:
  • S – A Stream Graph
  • L_functions – Functions according to the path’s type (supported : - foremost path - shortest foremost path - shortest path - fastest shortest path - fastest path - shortest fastest path)
Returns:
straph.attributed.algorithms.pairwise.F_update(F, batch_arrival, temporal_adjacency_list, nodes_to_update, L_functions)[source]¶

Proceed to BFS_Update W_n for every encounter node so far (i.e. in nodes_to_update). :param F: :param batch_arrival: :param temporal_adjacency_list: :param nodes_to_update: :param L_functions: :return:

straph.attributed.algorithms.simple module¶

straph.attributed.algorithms.single_source module¶

straph.attributed.algorithms.single_source.L_Algorithm(S, source, initialisation_function, update_function, start_time=None)[source]¶

An implementation of L-Algorithm (described in ~add ref) !! DIRECTED VERSION !!! Single Source Algorithm to compute temporal paths in Stream Graph

Parameters:
  • S – A Stream Graph
  • source – A temporal node (t,x) in W or a node x in V
  • initialisation_function – Initialisation according to the path’s type (supported : - foremost path - shortest foremost path - shortest path - fastest shortest path - fastest path - shortest fastest path)
  • update_function – Update according to the path’s type (supported : - foremost path - shortest foremost path - shortest path - fastest shortest path - fastest path - shortest fastest path)
Returns:

R containing the best results

# IMPORTANT : We suppose that we are in the WCC of ‘source’ otherwise it’s fucking expensive !

straph.attributed.algorithms.single_source.SP_update(L, R, link, priority)[source]¶

Update Lv with the best element of Lu ! :param L: Bigga Structure :param t0: current time :param t1: end of link :param u: node already updated (b0,e0,n0) :param v: node to update (b0,e0,n1) :param w: weight :param tr: traversal time :return:
